remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated door(s) is verified closed, latched, and locked before each departure.

note.para: ACARS operation may be affected if door light not extinguished. Complete Flight Data Coupon as described in FOM, Chapter 3.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "DOOR INDICATION INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Placard affected light (Pilot Overhead Panel) "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Visually check that all affected doors are closed and locked.
Forward and aft lower cargo doors:

numlitem.para: Unload cargo as necessary to place an individual with a flashlight in the cargo bay to observe the cargo door closing.
Close door.
The individual inside the bay will verify proper door closing.
Latch cranks move to the latched position (see illustration).
Movable upper stops move into position behind the upper door frame stops (see illustration).
Vent doors close (see illustration).
All door stops align with frame stops.
Open cargo door (allow individual to exit).
Reload cargo as necessary.
On all subsequent flights, perform the following:
Verify door is faired with fuselage.
Verify that door handles are in the proper faired/close position.
Verify vent doors close.

maintenance.para: Crew entry door, forward equipment bay and E/C compartment doors:

numlitem.para: Close the door.
Verify the door is faired with the fuselage.
Push on door to ensure it is properly closed and locked.

note.para: A malfunction that causes a "Main Cargo Door" message will also not allow normal operation of ACARS "OOOI" functions.

numlitem.para: If EICAS message "MAIN CARGO DOOR SYS" appears on EICAS display, perform the following to verify shutoff valve position:
Pressurize the aircraft left hydraulic system and close the main cargo door, then remove the left hydraulic system pressure.
Gain access to the left main gear wheel well and locate the main cargo door pressure switch (S10518).
Remove connector D7174 from the main cargo door pressure switch.
Verify electrical continuity exists across pins 2 and 3 on the pressure switch side of the main cargo door pressure switch (S10518).
Pressurize the aircraft left hydraulic system.
Verify electrical continuity remains across pins 2 and 3 of the main cargo door pressure switch (S10518).

note.para: If electrical continuity no longer exists across pins 2 and 3 of S10518 pressure switch after the left hydraulic system is pressurized, then DISPATCH is NOT allowed.

numlitem.para: Reconnect D7174 to the S10518 pressure switch.
Ensure main cargo door is still closed and faired.
Ensure main cargo door pressure relief doors are closed.
Ensure four white flags are viewable through the main cargo door lock view ports.
Remove aircraft left hydraulic system pressure.
If EICAS message "EICAS SCC" appears on EICAS display, perform the following:

para.emphasis: Door operation will not be affected with either or both connectors removed in the pursuing steps. The "DOOR NOT LOCKED" light will not be illuminated with D41160P disconnected and the main cargo door not locked CLOSED.

numlitem.para: Pressurize the aircraft left hydraulic system and close the main cargo door, then remove left hydraulic system pressure from the aircraft.
Gain access to the left main gear wheel well and locate the main cargo door pressure switch S10518.
Remove connector D7174 from the main cargo door pressure switch.
If EICAS message "EICAS SCC" IS NOT displayed, then cap, stow and secure D7174 for flight, go to step H.
If EICAS message "EICAS SCC" is still displayed with D7174 disconnected, then locate and disconnect D41160P at upper middle area of the main cargo door.
If EICAS message "EICAS SCC" is NOT displayed, then cap, stow and secure D41160P for flight.
Reconnect connector D7174 at the S10518 pressure switch.
Ensure main cargo door is still closed and faired.
Ensure main cargo door pressure relief doors are closed.
Ensure four white flags are viewable through the main cargo door lock view ports.
